EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {1.00}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Ingredients and Distribution or the cell corresponding to Produce and Marketing?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Produce} and {Marketing} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Meat and Consumption or the cell corresponding to Snacks and Marketing?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Snacks} and {Marketing} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Meat and Distribution or the cell corresponding to Snacks and Marketing?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Snacks} and {Marketing} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Ingredients and Imports or the cell corresponding to Bakery and Safety?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Ingredients} and {Imports} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.88 to 0.96?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Produce, Consumption), (Produce, Distribution), (Seafood, Distribution), (Produce, Imports), (Produce, Innovation), (Seafood, Innovation), (Snacks, Innovation), (Seafood, Marketing), (Snacks, Marketing)}.
